Since [[Wael Ghonim]]'s release from custody and an interview on DreamTV, thousands of supporters joined a Facebook page created in his honour. "We authorise Wael Ghoneim to speak on behalf of the Egyptian revolution."<ref name="aljazeera3">{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/middle-east/2011/02/07/live-blog-feb-8-egypt-protests |title=Live blog Feb 8 - Egypt protests | Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref>
Since [[Wael Ghonim]]'s release from custody and an interview on DreamTV, thousands of supporters joined a Facebook page created in his honour. "We authorise Wael Ghoneim to speak on behalf of the Egyptian revolution."<ref name="aljazeera3">{{cite web|url=http://blogs.aljazeera.net/middle-east/2011/02/07/live-blog-feb-8-egypt-protests |title=Live blog Feb 8 - Egypt protests | Al Jazeera Blogs |publisher=Blogs.aljazeera.net |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref>
â
In one of the largest protests yet, over a million people gathered in and around Tahrir Square to demonstrate.<ref name="aljazeera3"/> Some people were reported to be joining the protests for the first time. At least 1,000 protesters went to the [[Egyptian Parliament|parliament]] to demand Mubarak's resign. There was also a big protest in Alexandria<ref name="aljazlive"/>, while Suez Canal workers also went on strike.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/5231/Egypt/Politics-/Suez-Canal-workers-go-on-strike-.aspx |title=Five Suez Canal companies workers go on strike, no major disruptions witnessed yet - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref>
+
The same organisers of the "Day of Anger", "Friday of Anger", "March of the Millions" and "Friday of Departure" called for a protest in what was dubbed ({{lang-ar|ÙÙÙ Ø­Ø¨ ÙØµØ±}}).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.net/NR/exeres/789346B3-1C7E-408F-8F8B-13A8207298C5.htm?wbc_purpose=Basic%2CBasic_Current|title=ÙØ¸Ø§ÙØ±Ø§Øª ÙÙÙÙÙÙØ© Ø¨ÙØµØ± ØªØµØ¹ÙØ¯ Ø§ÙØ¶ØºØ·|publisher=Aljazeera|accessdate=09 February 2011}}</ref> meaning the "'''Day of Egypt's love'''". In one of the largest protests yet, over a million people gathered in and around Tahrir Square to demonstrate.<ref name="aljazeera3"/> Some people were reported to be joining the protests for the first time. At least 1,000 protesters went to the [[Egyptian Parliament|parliament]] to demand Mubarak's resign. There was also a big protest in Alexandria<ref name="aljazlive"/>, while Suez Canal workers also went on strike.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/64/5231/Egypt/Politics-/Suez-Canal-workers-go-on-strike-.aspx |title=Five Suez Canal companies workers go on strike, no major disruptions witnessed yet - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref>
In a statement made on Egyptian state television, Omar Suleiman announced formation of two independent committees for political and constitutional reforms, both starting work immediately. One committee would carry out constitutional and legislative amendments to enable a shift of power while a separate committee will be set up to monitor the implementation of all proposed reforms. Suleiman also stressed that demonstrators will not be prosecuted and that a separate independent fact-finding committee would be established to probe the violence of February 2.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/201128123235508653.html |title=Protests swell at Tahrir Square
In a statement made on Egyptian state television, Omar Suleiman announced formation of two independent committees for political and constitutional reforms, both starting work immediately. One committee would carry out constitutional and legislative amendments to enable a shift of power while a separate committee will be set up to monitor the implementation of all proposed reforms. Suleiman also stressed that demonstrators will not be prosecuted and that a separate independent fact-finding committee would be established to probe the violence of February 2.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/02/201128123235508653.html |title=Protests swell at Tahrir Square
